page.title: 11Industry continued
page.content: Up to 4000 tons were produced in a week.About 1/2 went to the Alkali Works for the sodium carbonate process and the rest went from a jetty on the Wyre (map ref 03480467) for export.The influx of Cheshire miners was known as the Northwich Invasion.When I.C.I. was formed in 1926 it took over the United Alkali Co. Mining stopped in about 1930 due to sudden flooding.Air controlled forced brine wells were pioneered at Preesall, this protects against subsidence and gives increased yield.Nowadays 3 concentric tubes are used.The outer (diameter 10.5") carries air at 600psi,the middle(7") of adjustable depth carries water at 180psi,and the brine enters the inner tube coming out at 7psi.The cavities are regularly checked by echo sounding so that the shape and size can be controlled.
